title: Reading the new story gave me a weird thought.
body: So we got a little more information about Iceborn and True Ice in the new story.  It's been mentioned before that only Iceborn can use True Ice weapons, but how does Trundle fit into that?  He's a troll, and isn't stated to be part-human or anything like that, so I'm guessing he's not descended from Avarosa/Serylda/Lissandra, as that would raise a lot of questions.  Can trolls just bypass that requirement?  Or can Iceborn like Lissandra bestow the capability?  Just a random thought.

replies.body:
Trolls are already magical creatures connected to the land.

Iceborn is a term for a type of magically gifted **human**.

Gotcha, thanks for the clarification!  I just want to say, it's really awesome seeing rioters answering little lore detail questions like mine around here.  Please keep it up, we really appreciate it!

Trundle is not of human race so he cant be a descendant of the Three... 
Trundle uses the club just as a normal material weapon and not as a magical one because he cant he isnt of Iceborn blood! 
For example: If trundle was to have Ashes bow which is also magical and can only be wielded by Iceborn blood, he could only use it as a normal bow and shoto arrows... Ashe however can shoot frost arrows from it and use its magical power... 
the club has magical powers that trundle cant use

Trundle literally summons pillars of ice.

I'm pretty sure he's utilizing the magic in that weapon.

> [{quoted}](name=GingahBread,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=IcUjXlkP,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-08-21T03:13:42.213+0000)
>
> Trundle literally summons pillars of ice.
> 
> I'm pretty sure he's utilizing the magic in that weapon.

That is only in game :) the games abilities are not the same as in lore!
Again, I would disagree. Having the game character directly contradict the lore character is a no-go. I went over this already.

Evelynn can kill people in game. Lorewise she needs people to touch her first in order to do that. I'm not sure Garen can summon a giant sword from the sky (cause it would be magic related and contradict his lore) ... And I'd like to see how Darius can heal from striking his ennemies with his axe.
Albeit I agree, most champions' abilities represent what they can do lorewise, but I'm pretty sure there are some singularities ! So better be careful about this "what a champion can do in game they can do in lore" stuff {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Evelynn can still kill people in the lore, and her gameplay reflects the lore well with her Charm. Not a contradiction.

Garen is in a weird spot where he's one of the first champions released, and then they completely changed Demacian lore to them now hating magic. He's the victim of a retcon, a position Trundle is decidedly _not_ in.

Darius healing is a gameplay mechanic, he doesn't have to heal from it in lore. It's not a contradiction, you're just obnoxiously nitpicking. If that's the game you want to play though, show me where it says Darius _can't_ heal from wounding enemies with his axe. Go on, I'll wait.

Trolls aren't humans. They follow different rules. It is entirely pointless to give a character a magic item if they cannot utilize said magic item. It's bad storytelling, and even worse when that character displays more than proficient use in magic.

Don't be intentionally obtuse.

Swain might indicate that Garen actually has innate magical powers.

"Ignorant of the very magic you carry into battle. How Demacian."
the game is not connected to the lore

I would disagree in this instance. 

If he cannot use the magic in the club, there is no reason for him to have the club. It could just be replaced with any old club and have it be exactly the same.

The lore says he has a magical club. He displays the ability to use ice magic, with the club appearing to be the source of said magical power. Therefore, it is reasonable to conclude that he can use the magical club.

You can't have the game directly contradict the lore, it would just cause unnecessary confusion.

even if he cant use the magic in the club its still made out of true ice so its gonna be more effective and durable than a plain wooden club so there is no reason for him to not have it over a normal club even if he cant use the magic 

but he still could be able to use magic but riot hasnt said anything about it yet so we dont know

No, if he can't use the magic there's no reason to make it a magic club. Make it a durable one? Sure. But not magic. There's no reason. 

We don't need them to say something about it. We can see it. We know he's using magic. He has a magic club. It's a very reasonable approach to assume that he can therefore use the magical club's magical abilities.
Either the trolls are innately magical or Lissandra actually turned Trundle into an iceborn troll through some method.

Why is this a question though? We know plain humans can't use true ice weapons mainly due to the fact that in the lore story about the descent into the Abyss, the Iceborn guy states that there's an insane, bone freezing chill radiating off the weapons that hurts him, and would pretty much kill anyone who's not Iceborn. So clearly, Iceborn have some kind of innate resistance to the cold that allows them more fortitude to wield those weapons.
So then we turn to Frost Trolls, magical humanoids inhabiting the Freljord, who clearly have this super high resistance to the cold due to how Trundle dresses with next to no clothing covering his naked torso. The trolls clearly don't care about the cold, so it's understandable that it'd be nothing for them to wield true ice with ease.

And as a note - this revelation that the Iceborn are resistant to the cold is ugly in that it's a justification for Ashe's miniskirt and exposed arms. After all, she _must_ be an Iceborn descendent due to her ability to wield the bow without dying.
Fell... he is a Frost Troll... maybe all Frost Trolls can use Ice Powers just like all Yetis can use Ice Powers

Assuming old lore, Lissandra gifted the club to Trundle especially for Trundle. It make logical sense that, if she fashioned it out of True Ice for him specifically, he could use it normally.

The same might go for any other person, provided they can stand the cold.

I personally always liked to imagine that the trolls were innately magical, and as such could naturally tap in to true ice, but never did because they never had the culture in place to figure out how to actually use it.

Considering the new lore for the yeti, I can imagine something similar for the frost trolls; an ancient people with an old, long since forgotten civilisation that did use that power in ancient times, but when everything they had fell to shit, they many of their old traditions.
